intro: Delphinium brachycentrum subsp. maydellianum, commonly known as the Maydell's larkspur, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems that bear clusters of blue to purple flowers. The leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, with a rough, hairy texture. This subspecies is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. It is valued in horticulture for its striking floral display and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
